solution_line_template: Since the other two harbors have {other_harbor_pounds} pounds of lobsters each, they have a total of {other_harbor_pounds}+{other_harbor_pounds}= <<{other_harbor_pounds}+{other_harbor_pounds}={combined_other_harbors}>>{combined_other_harbors} pounds of lobster.

Since Hooper Bay has two times more lobsters than the other two harbors combined, it has {hooper_bay_multiplier}*{combined_other_harbors} = <<{hooper_bay_multiplier}*{combined_other_harbors}={hooper_bay_pounds}>>{hooper_bay_pounds} pounds of lobster.
In total, the three harbors have {hooper_bay_pounds}+{combined_other_harbors} = <<{hooper_bay_pounds}+{combined_other_harbors}={total_pounds}>>{total_pounds} pounds of lobster.
